comment.body:
I think you can create your own board here. If you look at the All channels and you will get a huge list.
This is the part of the program code that needs to be cleaned up.
I dont know who coded this site but they need to set up all the channels on the right of the page.
looks like they started to but they quit.

When the side gets full have arrow buttons at the bottom  < > to scroll the room names.  Make sure that it stays current with the page they are on when they select it. Say they go to the 9th page and go into that room. That bar stays the same.  Many sites will just refresh the option and go back to the first set of rooms. That is annoying.  

Anyway just some ideas for the site developer. Maybe they will read this in the future. Coding a easy to use GUI screen with good features is an art form.

This is the part of the program code that needs to be cleaned up.I dont know who coded this site but they need to set up all the channels on the right of the page.looks like they started to but they quit. When the side gets full have arrow buttons at the bottom   to scroll the room names.  Make sure that it stays current with the page they are on when they select it. Say they go to the 9th page and go into that room. That bar stays the same.  Many sites will just refresh the option and go back to the first set of rooms. That is annoying.   Anyway just some ideas for the site developer. Maybe they will read this in the future. Coding a easy to use GUI screen with good features is an art form.

comment.body:
Arch is a command line install?  

Sorry if you want users you got to code a decent gui install that explains things as you install it. I just downloaded the debian dvd package and it was a total joke.  The installer had 3 DVD's and I swapped it out at least 40 times. Then it could not identify disk 2 half way into the install. Absolutely the worst Linux install I have ever used in my life.  Red Hat 1.1 was better! It even worked.

If the Linux Distribution contributors don't test the installer program don't release it.
And just because it works on your system does not mean it will work on every system.

Debian DVD Installer gets and F- for a grade.  Why so low? It Crashed on the install. A Bad script file.

It makes the distribution look bad and everyone involved look like total buffoons.
Lately the quality control side of all Linux Distributions have gone to Shit.

To many Newbie Virtual signalling program contributes get offended when you say there code is Shit and there installer is a piece of garbage.  If you cant take criticism you are a worthless human being.

I hope I offended the Debian Linux Cult of Network installers. 

Ya one may work right but the others are SHIT!!!

Absolutely the worst Linux install I have ever used in my life.  Red Hat 1.1 was better! It even worked. If the Linux Distribution contributors don't test the installer program don't release it. And just because it works on your system does not mean it will work on every system. Debian DVD Installer gets and F- for a grade.  Why so low? It Crashed on the install. A Bad script file. comment.body:
This site needs to fine tuning to get it up to a usable level. There are like 5 things that make this site extremely annoying to use. One is channel names. There are allot of them now, but you cant find them easily.
And I cant tell you how many times I have commented on things and it just goes no where. This site is Buggy. Who ever is running this ZeroVoat is very close to having a solid working design. To make this site popular the bugs must be fixed. Or people will post somewhere else.

comment.body:
I think the book idea is a good one. Just remember that Zeronet also has an app for android. Storage on those devices is very limited at best. I think a dual approach would work well. Some people use Zeronet on there desktop and storage is not an issue. 

I have lots of non fiction books I would love to share however uploading them one by one will take allot of time. Either way don't give up on the project and when you get it up and running advertise it on Zeronet everywhere. That way people will know it is there.
comment.body_p: I think the book idea is a good one. Just remember that Zeronet also has an app for android. Storage on those devices is very limited at best. I think a dual approach would work well. Some people use Zeronet on there desktop and storage is not an issue. I have lots of non fiction books I would love to share however uploading them one by one will take allot of time. Either way don't give up on the project and when you get it up and running advertise it on Zeronet everywhere. That way people will know it is there.

topic.title: This Zite Sucks!!!
topic.body:
WTF!! WHO EVER THE DEV IS HERE NEEDS TO GET HIS HEAD OUT OF HIS ASS AND START DOING THINGS RIGHT.

Pull down DROP DOWN MENU FOR CHANNEL NAMES IS ABOUT THE WORST POSSIBLE WAY TO MOVE AROUND BOARDS. MAYBE YOU DONT KNOW HTML OR MAYBE YOU DO.  IF YOU DO YOU ARE A COMPLETE MORON.  

DROP DOWN MENUS HIDE HOW MANY BOARDS YOU ACTUALLY HAVE AND ABOUT 2% OF THE USERS WOULD EVER BOTHER TO CLICK ON IT. 

CREATE IT AS A LIST ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE OF THE PAGE WITH ALL THE BOARD NAMES. 

(DO NOT USE SOME PUSH BUTTON DROP DOWN MENU SCROLL OPTION.)  (WHAT YOU ARE USING NOW!)

Also increase the font size by just + 2 points from where it is at now. The entire site.


This entire site is very unclear as to what each button does and how it works.  


DON'T STOP WORKING ON THIS!!!! 
This message board has massive potential.

topic.title: Cant Upload videos
topic.body: I just tried to upload a 2.3 gig video and a 1.3 gig video. The tab crashed in both of them. What is the maximum file size of video posting? And what video formats does this site support.  Site looks really good however the video uploads and documentation needs a little work. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

And what video formats does this site support.  Site looks really good however the video uploads and documentation needs a little work. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
